newsitem.title: UK: Telewest seeks to broaden phone licences.
newsitem.headline: Telewest seeks to broaden phone licences.

text.p: Cable television and telephone operator Telewest Communications Plc has applied for a licence to offer telephony services both in Britain and overseas, a spokesman for the company said.
"Our application for a national and international (licence) is on public record," the spokesman said.
Telewest was one of around 45 companies which met the government's deadline of July 22 to apply for a licence for international facilities, a Department of Trade and Industry (DTI) spokesman said.
These companies will be shortlisted from this first tranche as the government prepares for liberalisation of European telephone networks in 1998, he added.
Telewest is also applying for a licence to offer services nationwide. The company currently has licences to operate telephone services within its franchise areas.
"The DTI would agree that we would want to see more people (operating) nationwide," the DTI spokesman said.
